name: Sea Horse Restaurant

reviews.review_text:
So this is our honest review

Service: staff were not friendly , little unhygienic spoons were dirty. Did not help to choose .

Food : well we ordered sea food soup (again staff denied to make 1/2 ...lazy may be)  steam rice , Thai chicken curry ( wanted to try cafereal but they said they cannot make it less spicy...only they know why)
It takes almost 2 hours to reach

Taste : very stale food , had stomach issue

Think twice going to this place

Over expensive

Last day before leaving Goa we wanted to try a local joint. Took a chance with this place.  Ordered Calamari Butter Garlic, it was cooked to perfection and the butter garlic sauce was perfect. The next dish was Goan fish curry and steamed rice. They used sea bass in fish curry. Fish curry rice was extremely spicy. Thats my fault cause he asked if i wanted it spicy or less spicy. My reply was let it be as authentic it can be. Ended up with a very spicy fish curry.

What i liked best was the location of this restaurant, which was at the junction near the Church of our Lady of Milagres.  The decor of this place is good, open and airy.  The staff was prompt and attentive. The food was served quite fast. I like the rawa fried prawns, chicken Kadai....and the rotis were nice & crispy. However, the prawns curry with rice could have been better. Will surely visit next time if i pass by Morjim. Until then, have a wonderful experience travellers!! Viva‚úåüèª

description:
**Welcome to Sea Horse Restaurant: A Culinary Journey through Goan Delights**

Nestled in the heart of Pernem, Sea Horse Restaurant beckons patrons with a commendable rating of 4.0, based on 670 reviews. This eatery is a noteworthy spot for lovers of Goan and Indian cuisine, with customer feedback highlighting specialties such as prawns and various seafood options. The frequency of tags like "service" (37 mentions), "Goan food" (14 mentions), and "prawns" (14 mentions) indicate a diverse attention to the culinary offerings present within its menu.

**Ambiance & Design**

As you step into Sea Horse Restaurant, you‚Äôre greeted by an inviting, open space illuminated by natural light filtering through airy windows. The d√©cor is tastefully done, reflecting a laid-back beach vibe that perfectly complements its coastal cuisine. Customer reviews emphasize its convenient location right near the Church of Our Lady of Milagres, making it a delightful spot to unwind after a day of exploration. Visual highlights from customer-submitted photos, like the vibrant colors of the dishes and the rustic yet cozy setup, enhance your understanding of this establishment's charm. 

**Menu & Culinary Experience**

The menu offers a variety of traditional dishes, many of which leave a lasting impression on guests. Signature items include the **Calamari Butter Garlic**, described as "cooked to perfection," and the **Goan Fish Curry** served with steamed rice‚Äîthough guests should be wary of the spice level! One guest praised the **rawa fried prawns** and **chicken Kadai**, noting the crispy rotis as an exemplary accompaniment. However, feedback indicates that not all dishes meet the high expectations; one reviewer expressed disappointment regarding the stale food and unhygienic serving conditions. Dietary options are available, but diners may need to communicate specific preferences, as responses can vary.

**Customer Experience & Service**

Reviews present a mixed bag when it comes to service. While some patrons noted the prompt and attentive service, others reported encounters with unfriendly staff and cleanliness issues, particularly citing dirty utensils. It seems that while the wait time for food can stretch up to two hours at times, those who had pleasant interactions with the team found their experience markedly better. The restaurant appears to accommodate both walk-ins and reservations, giving diners flexibility for casual visits or planned outings.

**Popularity & Reviews**

Customer sentiment appears to be divided; while many patrons leave satisfied and eager to return, others express frustration over service lapses and food quality. The restaurant has fostered a buzz on social media, with many appreciating the authentic Goan atmosphere and hearty portions. Notably, travelers are drawn to Sea Horse for its local flavor as well as its scenic location, which adds to its appeal.

**Utilizing Visual Content**

Visual elements from customer photos paint a mouthwatering picture of the menu offerings and the restaurant ambiance. The images reveal colorful dishes, like the well-presented fish curry and artfully styled appetizers, that tempt future diners. Capturing the essence of the space, these visuals add depth to the dining experience, showcasing both the appeal of the food and the relaxed atmosphere.

In summary, Sea Horse Restaurant presents a unique blend of Goan culinary traditions and laid-back beach vibes. While there are areas needing improvement, especially in service and consistency, a solid selection of dishes and a pleasant environment keep diners coming back for more. If you're in the Pernem area, it's worth stopping by to embrace the flavors of Goa while enjoying the local scenery. Just remember to approach with realistic expectations for both service and spice levels!
